cleaned_text: WHEN TO CALL THE DOCTORSome people will not have any side effects from the vaccine, but some people will have some side effects for a few days. In the majority of cases, it's normal to have fever or pain for 1-3 days after getting the vaccine. Call your doctor or health care provider:Put a clean, wet towel on the place where you got the shot or exercise your arm Pain, swelling, or redness in the arm where you got the shot Fever Chills Tiredness Headache Nausea If the injection site on your arm gets red or becomes more sensitive after 24 hours or if the side effects don't get better after 1-3 daysTO REDUCE THE PAIN: USEFUL TIPSDrink lots of liquids and dress in light clothingTO HELP WITH THE FEVER: The side effects of the COVID-19 vaccines can include: Get the booster shots when you become eligible to lower your risk of getting very ill due to COVID-19. Wear a mask if you have had contact with anyone infected with COVID-19 or if there is a high risk of COVID-19 spread in your community. Get tested for COVID-19 if you feel any symptoms (cough, fever, etc.).
